content: saffron shawl based on the shawl in firefly our mrs reynolds episode by cirsium crochet this pattern uses us terminology abbreviations chain- chain chain space- chain-space us double_crochet- double_crochet double_crochet 3 together- dc3tog materials willow yarns daily tweeds dk 2 skeins = 568 0 yards 519 4 meters 200 grams in ancient jasper or 568 yds similar dk weight yarn 5 5mm/i hook or size needed to get gauge although gauge is not really essential scissors blunt tip needle for weaving in ends stitch marker size size is completely adjustable by changing the weight of the yarn size of the hook or working fewer/more row of the pattern sample shown in the photo is blocked to be 74 across the shoulders and 31 deep you can use worsted weight yarn with a 6 5mm/k hook and stop anywhere after row 15 for a quick project gauge pattern is a two-row repeat in the sample shown blocked distance between one dc3tog to the next is 5 5 blocked length of 6 row 3 repeats is 5 however gauge is not essential to this project i tried to closely approximate the size of the shawl in the tv show but you can customize this to your own personal taste and preference saffron shawl 1 special stitch dc3tog- yarn over insert hook into indicated stitch or chain-space yarn over pull loop through yarn over pull through two loops on hook three times yarn over pull through all loops remaining on hook notes *on odd row beginning after row 4 dc3tog s are worked with the first leg in a ch2-space the second leg in the previous row s dc3tog and the third leg is in the next ch2-space unless otherwise indicated in the pattern *on even row dc3tog s are worked with the first leg in a double_crochet the second leg is worked in the top of the previous row dc3tog and the third leg is in the next double_crochet unless otherwise indicated in the pattern *do not work the ch3 start chains too tightly do not substitute the ch3 s with a ch2 you will need extra stretch to help block the neckline straight if you tend to ch3 tightly work a ch4 instead do not worry about the neckline ch3 s looking sloppy you will be working over these stitches with a linen stitch edging that will help clean it up and give structure and support to the row ends main body foundation row chain 47 row 1 double_crochet in 4th chain from hook first 3 chains count as 1 double_crochet double_crochet in each of next 20 chs 3 double_crochet in next chain mark 2nd of these double_crochet s as center/apex double_crochet in each of next 22 chs turn 47 double_crochet row 2 ch3 2dc in first double_crochet ch2 skip 2 sts double_crochet ch3 double_crochet in next st ch2 skip 2 sts double_crochet in next st two times ch2 skip 2 sts dc3tog ch2 skip 2 sts double_crochet in next st
